communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting file numbers 94-HQ-64397 and 161-HQ-757, which, according to a FOIA officer at the FBI, contain records relevant to Charles Peters. Please release the file in full. 

Charles Peters was the former editor of Washington Monthly. He died in June 2023. This is his obituary: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/11/23/us/politics/charles-peters-dead.html

According to the report, he was born named Charles Given Peters Jr. in Charleston, W.Va., on Dec. 22, 1926.

Here is the FBI message for your reference https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/fbi-files-charles-peters-155094/#file-1133002

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting file number 100-NY-171579, which, according to a FOIA officer at the FBI, contains records relevant to Faith Ringgold. Please release the file in full. 

Faith Ringgold was a prominent American artist who died in April 2024. Here is her obituary: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/04/13/arts/faith-ringgold-dead.html

Here is the FBI message for your reference https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/fbi-files-faith-ringgold-162316/#file-1194030

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh
